contents.content: _{You may need to pick a subclass (bloodline, doctrine etc).}
_{Optionally, -2 in two abilities and +2 in one other.}
_{Two +2 from your background, one a free choice.}
_{Gain proficiencies from your background and class.}
_{Your proficiency bonuses at level 1 are: 0, 3, 5, 7 and 9. They increase as you level up.}
_{Become trained in a number of skills based on your class.}
_{If two sources give you training in the same skill, they don't add up. You may be able to spend the training elsewhere.}
_{Pathfinder Society characters must be at least young adults, and may not be evil.}
_{Check online to see which options are legal.}
_{Gain networking points to represent your training with the Pathfinder Society.}

rows.name: _{1pt}
rows.bonus: _{Your free consumable may be taken from your school's item list.}

rows.name: _{2pts}
rows.bonus: _{Trained in one lore skill. At level 5, gain a bonus skill feat.}

rows.name: _{3pts}
rows.bonus: _{Second free consumable taken from your school's item list, up to half your level.}

contents.content: _{[b]Networking points[/b] can be spent to buy consumables or lore skills.}
_{Gain 50% extra downtime between missions (12 days rather than 8).}

rows.name: _{Spells}
rows.bonusfeats:
_{Arcane Sense, Assurance,
Quick Identification, Recognise Spell}

rows.name: _{Swords}
rows.bonusfeats:
_{Cat Fall, Experienced Smuggler,
Forager, Hefty Hauler}

contents.content: _{Find a game through your local Venture-Captain or online.}
_{Start each game with one hero point and a free comsumable.}
_{Holy water, lesser bomb (alchemist), lesser antidote, lesser antiplague, minor healing potion}
_{Lesser healing potion, potion of water breathing}
_{[b]Fame[/b] represents your standing within the Pathfinder Society. Fame can be use to purchase faction boons.}
_{[b]Reputation[/b] represents your standing within your faction. A higher reputation unlocks faction boons you can purchase.}

_{You are skilled and opportunistic. Using your sharp wits and quick reactions, you take advantage of your opponents missteps and strike where it hurts most. You play a dangerous game, seeking thrills and testing your skills, and likely dont care much for any laws that happen to get in your way. While the path of every rogue is unique and riddled with danger, the one thing you all share in common is the breadth and depth of your skills.}
_{You move about stealthily so you can catch foes unawares. Youre a precision instrument, more useful against a tough boss or distant spellcaster than against rank-and-file soldiers.}
contents.title: _{During combat encounters...}

contents.content: _{Your skills give you multiple tools to influence your opposition. Pulling cons and ferreting out information are second nature to you.}
contents.title: _{During social encounters...}

contents.content: _{You sneak to get the drop on foes and scout for danger or traps. Youre a great asset, since you can disable traps, solve puzzles, and anticipate dangers.}
contents.title: _{While exploring...}

contents.content: _{Attack with a weapon or unarmed. On a critical success, deal double damage and possibly other effects.}
contents.title: _{Strike}

contents.content: _{Drop an item or take one hand off a weapon. Does not trigger reactions.}
contents.title: _{Release}

contents.content: _{Postpone your turn until later; jump in as a free action. You cannot use reactions until then.}
contents.title: _{Delay}

contents.content: _{Attempt a check to assist an ally with a check - at the risk of hindering them on a failure.}
contents.title: _{Aid}

contents.content: _{Prepare an action to take outside your turn on a certain trigger.}
contents.title: _{Ready}

contents.content: _{Move at half speed. The GM rolls your stealth check in secret. Gain +2 from cover or +4 from greater cover. You cannot sneak without concealment.}
contents.title: _{Sneak (Stealth)}

contents.content: _{Achieve 1 success (2 on a critical) towards disabling a device. Thieves' tools may be required.}
contents.title: _{Disable a Device (Thievery)}

contents.content: _{Achieve 1 success (2 on a critical) towards opening a lock. Thieves' tools may be required.}
contents.title: _{Pick a Lock (Thievery)}

contents.content: _{You can only use this once per turn.}
_{Creatures with a level more than twice the spell level, or more than the item level, treat the result of a check to incapacitate as one step higher.}
_{The GM rolls this check in secret.}
_{On a critical hit, add another damage die.}
_{Can use this weapon to disarm. Add the weapon's attack bonus to an Athletics check to disarm.}
_{Can add your Dex rather than Str to attack rolls. Does not affect damage.}
_{Knock an enemy out rather than killing them. -2 to make a lethal attack.}
_{May use 10 + proficiency bonus (inc level, but no other bonuses) rather than roll.}
contents.title: _{Assurance}

contents.content: _{Move at half speed. The GM rolls your stealth check in secret. Gain +2 from cover or +4 from greater cover. You cannot sneak without concealment.}
contents.title: _{Sneak (Stealth)}

contents.content: _{Achieve 1 success (2 on a critical) towards disabling a device. Thieves' tools may be required.}
contents.title: _{Disable a Device (Thievery)}

contents.content: _{Achieve 1 success (2 on a critical) towards opening a lock. Thieves' tools may be required.}
contents.title: _{Pick a Lock (Thievery)}

contents.content: _{Deduct hardness, then apply remaining damage to both shield and yourself.}
contents.title: _{Shield Block}

contents.content: _{May be legendary in skills}, _{Greater Weapon Specialisation}
_{When you attack a flat-footed opponent with an agile or finesse weapon/unarmed strike, or a ranged weapon.}
_{On the first round of combat, if you roll Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted yet are flat-footed.}
_{Not flat-footed to hidden, undetected or flanking creatures, or surprise attacks by creatures up to your level.}
_{When you make a critical hit with a suitable weapon, apply the weapon's critical specialisation effect.}
_{On hitting a flat-footed target, inflict an effect until the end of your next turn:}
_{When your strike hits a flat-footed creature and deals damage, they must also attempt a Fortitude save.}

defs.critical_failure: _{Paralysed for 4 rounds, knocked unconscious for 2 hours, or killed (your choice)}

contents.content: _{You can deal sneak attack damage with any simple weapon}
_{When you critically hit a flat-footed target with a simple weapon, apply the critical effect}
_{You don't gain these benefits with a weapon with a damage die larger than d8}
_{May choose strength as your key ability}
_{Trained in Pathfinder Lore, and trained in a skill of your choice or expert in a skill you were already trained in}
_{Always get a check for traps, even if you aren't searching for them.}
_{Cast this cantrip at will using your wayfinder}
_{Transform your wayfinder into a nondescript pin or broach for 1 hour.}
_{When you successfully aid an ally's attack roll or AC against an enemy, gain +1 to that attack or AC against that enemy respectively until the end of your next turn.}
_{Bonus to recall knowledge about a creature after previously succeeding at a knowledge check against that creature type.}
